result.markdown: --- title: "Activity 19" subtitle: "MATH 216: Statistical Thinking" format: html echo: false fig.width: 3 --- ## Activity 1: Quiz - **Question:** Given a sample mean $\bar{x} = 5.2$, a population standard deviation $\sigma = 2.5$, and a sample size $n = 100$, calculate the 95% confidence interval for the population mean $\mu$. \vspace*{1in} ## Activity 2: Data Exploration - **Task:** Use the following R-code output to calculate the sample mean and standard deviation, then infer the shape, mean, and spread of the population and sampling distribution. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data_vector <- c( 2, 3, 8, 6, 4, 4, 6, 4, 2, 5, 8, 10, 4, 4, 4, 2, 1, 3, 2, 10, 1, 3, 2, 3, 4, 3, 5, 2, 4, 1, 2, 9, 1, 7, 17, 9, 9, 9, 4, 4, 1, 1, 1, 3, 1, 6, 3, 3, 2, 5, 1, 3, 3, 14, 2, 3, 9, 6, 6, 3, 5, 1, 4, 6, 11, 22, 1, 9, 6, 5, 2, 2, 5, 4, 3, 6, 1, 5, 1, 6, 17, 1, 2, 4, 5, 4, 4, 3, 2, 3, 3, 5, 2, 3, 3, 2, 10, 2, 4, 2 ) mean(data_vector) #xbar ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 4.53 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} sd(data_vector) #s ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 3.677546 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Activity19_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Activity19_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Activity 3: Understanding Confidence Intervals ![Confidence Intervals](images/Day19-5.png){ width=50% } ![100(1-$\alpha$) CI](images/Day19-6.png){ width=100% } ![90% CI](images/Day19-7.png){ width=100% } What is the correct interpretation of $100(1-\alpha)\%$ confidence intervals for a mean of a population? \vspace*{1in} ## Activity 4: Group Activities with Real Data - **Task:** Using the provided dataset in Activity 2, calculate a 95% confidence interval for the population mean $\mu$. Interpret the results in the context of the problem. \vspace*{1in} ## Activity 5: Case Studies and Problem-Solving - **Case Study:** A hospital wants to estimate the average length of stay for its patients. They have collected data from 30 patients and found a sample mean of 5 days with a standard deviation of 5 days. Calculate a 95% confidence interval for the average length of stay and interpret the results. Use the interval estimator $\bar{x} \pm 1.96 \sigma_{\bar{x}}$ to calculate a confidence interval for the target parameter, $\mu$.
